title: News Briefs 24-11-2022
cleaned_text:
The End is the Beginning is the End.
• First U.S. polio case in nearly a decade highlights the importance of vaccination. Not to mention the need for EDUCATION…
• Pre-collapse concerns: Just how healthy would a cannibalistic diet be, anyway?
• Workers at the largest iPhone factory in China are treated like slaves.
• Tangentially Speaking interviews climate scientist Charlie Zender: a very engaging and honest discussion about why the years ahead are gonna be rough, no matter how much we try to deny it.
• This is fine: San Francisco Police Department wants to use robots to kill suspects.
• US Senators fear that made-in-China drones are swarming all over American skies.
• Remember that UAP report that was supposed to be released by Halloween? Well I have some bad news for y’all…
• Conspirinormal interviews Joshua Cutchin about his book Ecology of Souls Vol. 2.
• Pic of the Day: Ontario photographer captures massive wave that looks like ‘the perfect face’.
• Man explains why he’s been standing up for 12 years and won’t sit down.
• A spider monkey was once sent to the city of Teotihuacan as a peace offering by the Maya. Then the monkey was given the ‘diplomatic reception’…
• When archaeologists explored a ruined Aztec temple, they opened a gateway to a lost world.
• Red Pill of the Day: Disrespectful tourist who climbed Chichen Itzá’s pyramid gets booed and fined –why fined, where there are perfectly good sacrificial stones just sitting there?

Thanks to Indrid Lukewarm. And Happy Thanksgiving to all who celebrate it!

Quote of the Day:
